form.IN:
Pri 1., 2. in 4. pomenu je primernik
more
, presežnik pa
most
: glej posamezni gesli.

sense.def:
Z izrazom
much
poudarimo, da je nekaj res v veliki meri.

seg.quote: Myra and I are looking forward very much to the party.
Now I feel much more confident.

sense.def:
Če se nekaj ne dogaja
much
, se ne zgodi zelo pogosto.

seg.quote: She doesn't talk about them much.

sense.def:
Kadar sta dve stvari
much the same
, sta si zelo podobni.

seg.quote: The landscape was then much as it is today.
The two poems convey much the same emotional tone.

sense.def:
Izraz
much
uporabljamo tudi za veliko količino ali delež nečesa.

seg.quote: Much of the recent trouble has come from outside.

sense.def:
Izraz
much
uporabljamo, ko prosimo za podatke o količini ali jih potrebujemo.

seg.quote: How much did he tell you?
He's done as much as I have.
I doubt if she sees as much of him as you do.
How much money have you got left?

sense.def:
Kadar je nekaj
not so much one thing as another
, je bolj podobno drugi stvari kot prvi.

seg.quote: It was not so much an argument as a monologue.

sense.def:
Izraz
so much for a particular thing
pomeni, da omenjeno ni bilo uspešno ali koristno.

cit.quote: pa imamo, pa takšen, pa toliko, hvala lepa za

seg.quote: So much for the experts and their learning.

sense.def:
Izraz
nothing much
pomeni tako malo, da ni pomembno.

Kadar je položaj ali dejanje
too much for someone
, je za nekoga prezahtevno ali prenaporno.

seg.quote: The long journey each day might prove too much for him.

sense.def:
Kadar nekaj opišemo kot
not much of a particular type of thing
, to pomeni, da je majhno ali slabe kakovosti.

seg.quote: It wasn't much of a garden.

sense.def:
I thought as much
rečemo takrat, ko izvemo nekaj, kar smo pričakovali ali domnevamo.
